from pyspark.sql import SparkSession

# Path to the CSV file
df = spark.read.csv("abfss://vaesto@group2projectstorage.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/languages_data.csv", header=True, inferSchema=True, encoding="Latin1")

# Show the schema and preview the data
#df.printSchema()
#df.show(truncate=False)

display(df)

import re

# Function to rename columns: remove numbers, parentheses, hyphens, and make lowercase
new_columns = [re.sub(r'[^\w\s]|\d+', '', col) # Remove numbers and special characters like (), -, etc.
                .strip()
                .replace(" ", "_") # Replace spaces with underscores
                .replace("ä", "a")  # Replace ä with a
                .replace("ö", "o")  # Replace ö with o
                .lower() # Convert to lowercase
            for col in df.columns]
        
# Apply new column names
for old_name, new_name in zip(df.columns, new_columns):
    df = df.withColumnRenamed(old_name, new_name)

# Rename "alue" to "kunta" if it exists
if "alue" in df.columns:
    df = df.withColumnRenamed("alue", "kunta")

# Show the DataFrame with the updated column names
display(df)

# Print the updated column names in separate lines
print("Updated Columns in DataFrame:")
for col in df.columns:
    print(col)

print(f"Total number of columns: {len(df.columns)}")

# Define output path
output_path = "abfss://vaesto@group2projectstorage.dfs.core.windows.net/silver/finswe/finswe_data.parquet"

# Save DataFrame as Parquet
df.write.mode("overwrite").parquet(output_path)

print("Data successfully saved to ADLS in Parquet format.")
